text: we talk about the leader the military
the nuclear program but there's a part
of North Korea we don't usually talk
about that touches all aspects of life
there that can be traced straight back
to the country's founding myths the
mountains they help explain why North
Korea has become a ruthless police state
ruled by a 33 year old dictator and why
that matters now about 80% of the Korean
Peninsula is mountainous
most of those mountains are in the north
and above them all towers the volcanic
Mount paektu mountains
the crater at the top which is now a
lake formed during one of the largest
eruptions in history the mountain is a
mysterious one where wonders are made
more recently just six years ago an
unusual snowstorm enveloped the
mountains peak layers of lake ice gave a
tremendous crack and as the Sun rose a
message carved into the mountain glowed
bright mount paektu holy mountain of
revolution Kim Jong Il
kim jong ill the country's second leader
father of the current one had just died
and these were natural wonders that
marked his passing at least that's what
state propaganda say mount paektu is a
hugely important spiritual symbol for
North and South Korea and the Kim
dynasty exploits this to legitimize it
to rule they claim to be from the peak
to revolutionary bloodline so the
legends go the country's founder Kim
il-sung fought the Japanese occupation
of Korea from out Kate to his son Kim
jong-il was set to be born in the secret
base on its slopes not exactly
historians actually say he was born in
Russia the truth is Kim jong-il
manufactured the peg to bloodline myth
to make sure he'd become his father's
successor and so the mountain is a big
part of the Kim's cult of personality
they're often just opposed with the
rugged terrain to project strength
there's even this hit North Korean pop

and since he's young and inexperienced

millions died and in 1958 the u.s.

it's a lie so as Kim il-sung said about
rebuilding and rearming what would
become North Korea
all of this was on his mind he began to
dig under the mountains and North Korea
became one of the most heavily fortified
countries in the world there's an
estimated 8,000 to 15,000 underground
facilities factories are on the ground
there's underground Air Force hangars
and runways that cut through mountains
naval bases with underground ports
artillery pieces shielded in caves the
world's fifth largest army hidden and
protected by mountains now Kim jong-un
is hidden too often traveling through
long mountain tunnels to evade spy
satellites
and other would-be threats so any attack
on North Korea isn't just about
penetrating rockface it's about knowing
where the targets are in the first place

60 miles southeast of Mount paektu sits
Mount Montauk this is the heart of North
Korea's nuclear program all six of the
country's nuclear tests took place here
this cross-section which shows two of
those tests gives you an idea of just
how these are taking place but the tests
may be taking a toll on the mountain
analysts say test induced tremors and
landslides like these on the mountain
before and after a recent test may mean
some tunnels at the test site have
collapsed but that doesn't mean the
mountain can't sustain more tests though
there's other unused tunnels at the site
and with war rhetoric at a dangerously
high level the next test may trigger
more than just a landslide
